qas.question: Who founded the earliest Baptist church in North America?
When was the first American Baptist church established?
Where did Roger Williams establish a Baptist church?
Where did John Clarke establish a Baptist church?

answers.text: his compatriot and coworker for religious freedom

qas.question: Who founded the earliest Baptist church in South America?
Where did Roger Williams lose a Baptist church?
Where did John Clarke establish an Anabaptist church?
When was the last American Anabaptist church established?

context: Both <a0_0><b5_0>Roger Williams and John Clarke<b5_0/><a0_0/>, <a4_0>his compatriot and coworker for religious freedom<a4_0/>, are variously credited as founding the earliest Baptist church in North America. In <a1_0><b8_0>1639<b8_0/><a1_0/>, Williams established a Baptist church in <a2_0><b6_0>Providence, Rhode Island<b6_0/><a2_0/>, and Clarke began a Baptist church in <a3_0><b7_0>Newport, Rhode Island<b7_0/><a3_0/>. According to a Baptist historian who has researched the matter extensively, "There is much debate over the centuries as to whether the Providence or Newport church deserved the place of 'first' Baptist congregation in America. Exact records for both congregations are lacking."
